text: <@UDY957C6M> has left the channel

super random but wondering what peoples feels are on this:
You ask for a service to be performed, employee of a business performs that service, you thank them. They respond with “My pleasure”. How does that reaction make you feel?
Feels normal to me
But now I’m getting self-conscious about it
I don’t think the pleasure is derived from adjusting the copy in the careers page header. The pleasure is in assisting you.
“Happy to help” feels like the same statement to me
Is this like noticing that you’re breathing? It doesn’t feel weird unless you think about it.
YOU ARE NOW AWARE OF YOUR TONGUE

I was just responding to a client and it made me think about it - because whenever I go to Chik-fil-a and they say “my pleasure” after taking your order, and handing you your food (any time you say “thank you”) and my feeling on it is like “I don’t buy it, it’s weird, and the fact that’s your go-to response feels almost cultish”
At Chik-fil-a employees are forced to say it though. Maybe that makes it extra weird?
true. I almost feel like

“my pleasure” is what you work up towards. so like Customer A - been working with for months and they’re a good client - they get “my pleasure”, Customer B - been working with for only a little while “no problem!” “you’re welcome!” “anytime!”
lol “how to delight even after you complete your client’s tasks - Inbound 2019”
I think it depends on how much emphasis is placed on the phrase..

:point_up: True
"my pleasure"
"*my* pleasure"
"my *pleasure*"
all sound creepy

kinda makes me think, long long time ago in a galaxy far far away - I used to work at a deli+gas station and after serving people I’d say “have fantastic day” in an enthusiastic voice (never sarcastic) I got comments on the fact I always responded like that, many customers thought it was an uplifting thing, and others were like “I don’t buy it, no ones that consistently happy/uplifting”.

Guess probably no matter what you say people might bring their own baggage and interpret things different anyways
This is all reminding me of the "you're welcome" vs "no problem" debate
You’re problem
No welcome

with the above, this is why it would be awesome to be able to create forms used for submitting information to the portal instance. Like a HubDB form for entries or submit a file form where all files attached to that form going into a pre-defined folder in the File Manager.
My projects always start so fresh, fast forward 6 months and it's a nightmare - no matter how many times I beg our marketers to upload to the proper folders :cry:.

It would be pretty cool if we could limit where the files go when uploading. For example if I have a module that has a background image - I could set in the DM that anything uploaded through that image widget get's placed in _____ folder.
Re: “My Pleasure”  I catch my self saying it all the time because I worked at Chick Fil A in Highschool and you have to say that everytime someone says Thank You
one day I’m going to go in there and just thank them for every minor little thing they do while I’m there. see if  “my pleasure” starts to sound more and more sarcastic or angry
Totally agree! ... Passed this feedback along to the product team. We’ll see what happens
what is the HubSpot sanctioned spotify playlist?
<https://open.spotify.com/user/smashmouthofficial/playlist/7bAZ2HBmsKT3cgw90URrNk?si=MjUb7GghRJev72EYshiCOg>
BRILLIANT
will tune into  that right after i finish this barenaked ladies christmas album
Oh I love that album
how can you not?!
And speaking of amazing Christmas albums, Twisted Christmas is a gem
hmmm
i’m on it
lol
